messages.title: A PERSONAL MESSAGE FROM DAVID CAMERON WHY WE NEED CHANGE IN BRITAIN TODAY
messages.content: Dear Resident, Thirteen years ago Labour were elected promising change. But today, with the economy in a mess and a growing gap between rich and poor, a lot of people feel let down. Perhaps you're one of them. I'm writing to you today to tell you that you don't need to give up the hope for a fairer, stronger country. The Conservative Party has the energy and ideals to change Britain. ... I hope you take this chance to vote for change.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Committed to get the economy moving by tackling the debt and over two years create 400,000 new apprenticeships, training places and work pairings.
Increase spending and improve family-friendly policy around Sure Start health visitors.
Proposes to freeze council taxes and protect winter fuel payments, free bus passes and free TV for seniors.

mentions.candidate: Anna has been campaigning to defend our Green belt from developers..., Anna Soubry has worked to get common sense back into parking in Beeston...

issues.socialWelfare: Proposes to freeze council taxes and protect winter fuel payments, free bus passes and free TV for seniors.

housing.content: Anna Soubry has worked to get common sense back into parking in Beeston...

leaflet.personalStatement: Why are you giving up a successful career as a criminal Barrister to be an MP? ... I want to be part of the change we need in a fresh and public quality politicians who don't know what life is really like. It would be an honour to represent you and be your voice in Parliament.

politicalExperience.achievements: Defending Green belt, improving parking in Beeston

contactInformation.address: Broxtowe Conservatives, King Edward Court, King Street, Nottingham, NG9 2TA

endorsements.endorsement: Dear Resident, ... The Conservative Party has the energy and ideals to change Britain.

images.caption: Photos of Anna Soubry with different people, including David Cameron and local community.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Anna's FACTFILE - Born 21.12.56 in the hospital where her mother worked as a nurse. Education: Hartland Comprehensive in Worksop, read law at Birmingham and called to the Bar by Lincoln's Inn. Work: newspapers journalist before joining Central TV. Anna returned to the Bar for 16 years. Family: Anna's family goes back generations in Nottingham and the East Midlands.
